newsitem.title: GREECE: Olympic Airways reports 9.9 bln drs profit.
newsitem.headline: Olympic Airways reports 9.9 bln drs profit.

text.p: Greece's state carrier Olympic Airways was back in the black, registering a profit of about 9.9 billion drachmas ($40.4 million) in fiscal 1995 after 19 years of losses, it said in a statement.

"After 19 years of registering losses, the 1995 fiscal year was a profit-making one for Olympic Airways with the company showing a high cash balance and a real profit of some 9.9 billion drachmas," it said.

"It is too early for 1996 results because the year is not over yet," said Annie Manta, chief public relations officer when asked to clarify whether there were any results for 1996. "The 1996 results will be out at the end of 1997. This is what most companies do with their results."
The company's statement of accounts for 1995 was approved by its board of directors on September 17 1996, it said.
The operating profits stood at 13.3 billion drachmas in 1995 and cash liquidity increased to 49.7 billion drachmas at the end of 1995 compared to 21.5 billion in 1994, it said.
"The company's aims continue to focus on full implementation of the restructuring plan approved by the EU Commission on October 7, 1994 and the Greek government on December 14, 1994," it said.
